newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU aims for October decision on Alitalia plan.
newsitem.headline: EU aims for October decision on Alitalia plan.

text.p: The European Commission said on Wednesday it would aim to reach a decision in October on whether to clear a rescue plan for troubled state airline Alitalia.
European transport policy spokesman Sarah Lambert told reporters about a meeting of Alitalia and Commission aviation officials on Tuesday, the first formal meeting on the case.
They discussed Italian plans for a 1.5 trillion lire ($982 million) capital increase for the struggling carrier.
The plan was approved by industrial state industrial holding company IRI, Alitalia's majority sharerholder, in July.
Alitalia says it is a question of a capital injection that any investor would make, and that the plan does not involve state aid, which the Commission approves only under special circumstances.

"At this stage we are not in a position to say whether we accept the Italian presentation that it is indeed an ordinary injection of capital or whether indeed we will decide this is a state aid in which case we will follow the normal state aid procedures," Lambert said.
The Commission would study the case carefully.
"We will try to come to that decision by the end of October," she said. There had been no complaints from Alitalia's competitors, Lambert said.
